newsitem.title: FRANCE: Strauss-Kahn hopes deficit as low as possible.
newsitem.headline: Strauss-Kahn hopes deficit as low as possible.

text.p: French Finance Minister Dominique Strauss Kahn said on Wednesday he hoped an audit of public finances would show the deficit as low as possible.
But he told reporters after a weekly cabinet meeting it would not be as low as three percent of gross domestic product.
"I hope that the deficit will be as low as possible," he said.
He declined to confirm that the audit would show a deficit slightly above 3.5 percent of GDP, saying he was awaiting the results of the audit.
The government is due to release the findings of the audit on Monday.
French radio quoted Christian Sautter, junior budget minister, as saying the audit would show a deficit a little over 3.5 percent of GDP.
